oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EXPERIMENTAL STUDY OF OVERTOPPING PERFORMANCE FOR THE CASES OF VERY STEEP SLOPES AND VERTICAL WALLS WITH VERY SMALL FREEBOARDS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Troch, Peter
Mollaert, Justine
Peelman, Sofie
Victor, Lander
van der Meer, Jentsje
Gallach-Sánchez, David
Kortenhaus, Andreas
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wave overtopping
steep low-crested slopes
zero freeboard
vertical wall
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This article describes the investigation of average wave overtopping performance for sloping coastal structures characterised by very steep slopes (typically cot Î± < 0.5) and very small freeboards. Based on experimental tests, performed in the large wave flume of Ghent University, the influence of the relevant hydraulic and geometrical parameters on overtopping is examined. Test set-up and test parameters are presented and discussed in detail in this paper. Furthermore, the established dataset, called UG13 dataset, is compared to prediction formulae from existing literature, including the limiting cases of zero freeboard and vertical wall.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 34 (2014): Proceedings of 34th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Seoul, Korea, 2014; structures.2
